page.title: 16LIFE IN A GROCER'S SHOP
page.content: I wake up at 6.30 and wait till my Mother and Father to wake up.I have a wash and go down stairs. Skip (my Dog) waits for me downstairs.We wait for Derek (the man who brings the bread) to come at 6.40. Mum goes round to the shop{(E.W.Taylors & sons:Grocers)}and stocks up with bread. At 8.00 we open the shop and Janice Parker (our assistant)arrives.Usually people don't come until about 8.30 so while we wait we do some orders.People give us orders for food, we pack them in boxes and they pay. Round 9.00 things start to liven up .In the holiday I am the cashier. We go home at 1.00 and have dinner and a cup of coffee . At 2.00 we go back to the shop and serve customers until 6.00. Some of the prices are:- {Potatoes 20p a pound,Lettuce 22p each, {Apples 28p per lb.:}Carol Bennett (10)
